channel.description: The top News headlines from The Sydney Morning Herald. For all the news, visit https://www.smh.com.au
channel.title: Sydney Morning Herald - Latest News

item.dc:creator: Matt Bungard
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: COAG to be replaced by national cabinet as NSW eases COVID-19 restrictions on weddings, funerals; Australian death toll stands at 103

item.dc:creator: Sarah Keoghan
item.description: Speaking publicly for the first time on Bronson Xerri's positive test result, John Morris says he has been unable to contact the 19-year-old since the news broke.
item.title: 'I've reached out': Sharks coach still hasn't heard from Xerri over doping scandal

item.description: Former Test quick Peter Siddle has signed a two-year contract with the Tasmanian Tigers.
item.title: Siddle inks two-year deal with Tasmania

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Queensland police gave an update on the investigation into the death of 4-year-old Willow Dunn at a Cannon Hill home.
item.title: Willow Dunn suffered 'sustained mistreatment', police allege

item.dc:creator: Marissa Calligeros
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should call (not visit) your GP or ring the national Coronavirus Health Information Hotline on 1800 020 080.
item.title: Coronavirus updates LIVE: COAG abolished in place of national cabinet; Victorians abandoning the work-from-home effort; Keilor Downs student tests positive

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: Temperatures are rising and tempers are fraying in the United States. Minneapolis is on fire,40 million are unemployed and 100,00 people have died from COVID-19.
item.title: America at boiling point: how one death rocked a nation numbed by 100,000

item.dc:creator: Emma Young
item.description: In Mid-May, Premier Mark McGowan initially predicted this further easing of restrictions would occur from mid-June.
item.title: Gathering numbers up, social distance down in WA's next step out of restrictions

item.dc:creator: Laura Chung
item.description: The 35-year-old woman is in a critical condition after she was bitten on the neck and head by two big cats at the zoo on the NSW South Coast.
item.title: Two lions attack female keeper at Shoalhaven Zoo

item.dc:creator: Max Koslowski
item.description: COAG will be abolished in place of a new system after the success of the national cabinet, Prime Minister Scott Morrison has announced.
item.title: 'COAG is no more': National cabinet abolishes Council of Australian Governments

item.dc:creator: Patrick Hatch
item.description: Canadian asset manager Brookfield has made an 11th hour attempt to re-enter the race to buy Virgin Australia ahead of administrators Deloitte choosing a final shortlist of bidders over the weekend.
item.title: Canadian funds giant Brookfield makes 11th hour bid for Virgin Australia

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: Locations which may be affected from Friday morning include Albany, Bunbury, Busselton, Katanning, Mandurah, Manjimup, Margaret River, Mount Barker, Narrogin and Perth.
item.title: Storm warning: Parts of WA urged to prepare as another cold front closes in

item.dc:creator: Nick Galvin
item.description: For vulnerable residents living in aged care facilities everywhere life under lockdown has been lonely, frightening and dull.
item.title: 'Absolutely marvellous': There's an opera star in the garden

item.dc:creator: Danielle Cronin
item.description: If you suspect you or a family member has coronavirus you should contact (not visit) your GP, local hospital or 13HEALTH.
item.title: Coronavirus LIVE Queensland updates: race to solve mystery of Blackwater death and national cabinet meets

item.description:
The best photos from the international wire agencies as chosen by our picture editors.

Follow us on SMH Twitter and AGE Twitter
item.title: Gallery: The best photos from around the world

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Melbourne Storm players and coaches have offered insights into the monotonous testing and reporting that greets them every day but also allows them to continue working during the COVID-19 pandemic.
item.title: 'Inside the green zone': protocols that allowed NRL to resume

item.dc:creator: Emma Young
item.description: The 30-year-old's husband was out at work, and she was in her Herdsman Parade unit with her son asleep next to her, when she woke to the man's attack.
item.title: Wembley mother attacked as her five-year-old slept beside her: police

item.dc:creator: Daile Cross
item.description: Life in Western Australia is about to get a lot closer to normal with restrictions on a large range of things to be lifted from Saturday, June 6.
item.title: WA coronavirus LIVE: Gatherings of up to 100 to be allowed as restrictions ease as of next weekend

item.dc:creator: Tony Moore
item.description: The Rockhampton nurse whose travel to Malaysia and Blackwater is now being investigated by Queensland Health had followed safety protocol, according to her union.
item.title: Nurse's union defends Blackwater trip, says she could not have infected miner

item.dc:creator: Christian Nicolussi
item.description: Matt Dufty was a standout during an opposed session last Saturday and tipped to star for the Red V on Saturday afternoon.
item.title: 'He's given us plenty of confidence': Dufty forces Dragons to keep him at fullback

item.description: Hawthorn are optimistic injured midfielder Jaeger O'Meara can avoid donning a Jason Dunstall-esque crash helmet and appear in round two.
item.title: O'Meara waiting for all-clear from medical team

item.dc:creator: Peter Hannam
item.description: The Murray Darling Basin Authority chief says water markets favour high-margin crops over traditional industries at the cost of regional communities.
item.title: Water market may not be 'good thing for the country', Basin chief says

item.dc:creator: Andrew Wu
item.description: Cricket Australia has asked that the men's T20 World Cup be pushed back a year as the sport's global politics begin to resemble something out of a spy novel.
item.title: CA wants T20 World Cup pushed to 2021 as politics takes spooky turn

item.description: Dangerous driver who hit a policeman on the side of a road had to be removed from his own sentencing after he started to get agitated and began making threats.
item.title: Video sentencing halted after prisoner threatened to 'destroy things'

item.description: The next NBL season is likely to start at least one month later than normal to avoid clashing with Australia’s football finals and maximise the potential of crowds being able to attend.
item.title: NBL plans for delayed season start to accommodate fans

item.description: Protesters set a police precinct building on fire in Minneapolis as riots spread to neighbouring St Paul, amid anger over the death of George Floyd, a handcuffed black man in police custody.
item.title: Minneapolis rioters storm police station in third night of violent protest

item.dc:creator: Matt Dennien
item.description: Child Safety Minister Di Farmer announced the investigation on Friday after the death of Willow Dunn and discovery of two teenage boys at a home in Stafford.
item.title: Investigation launched into 'horrific' cases of alleged child neglect

item.description: An AFL fan site is contacting members after cyber security researchers found about 70 million records were exposed for download.
item.title: Big Footy data breach exposed private details of up to 100,000 users

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: A lawyer suing billionaire Sydney property developer Harry Triguboff alleges he was sacked from his prestigious job for refusing to lie in an affidavit.
item.title: Former Triguboff lawyer claims he was sacked for refusing to lie

item.dc:creator: Adam Cooper
item.description: Man who used his good character to gain the trust of victims and their families jailed for sexually assaulting boys in crimes going back more than 60 years.
item.title: Church volunteer, 79, jailed for sexual offences dating back to 1950s

item.dc:creator: Kate Hedley
item.description: Marie Stopes' spokeswoman for the safe access zones campaign, Jacquie O’Brien, said picketers had no understanding of the harm they caused.
item.title: Anti-abortion protesters 'upsetting clients' as they return to picket Perth clinic

item.description: AFL boss Gillon McLachlan says extended interchange benches aren't in the mix for the start of round two, but could be a lever pulled later in the season.
item.title: Bench increase unlikely for round two: McLachlan

item.dc:creator: Adrian Proszenko
item.description: No one was under more scrutiny in the NRL's return game than referee Gerard Sutton. Thankfully, all the water-cooler talk on Friday is about the game itself.
item.title: 'Last night was perfect': Referee avoids spotlight in season opener

item.description: The country has reported 177 new cases over the past three days. It had already begun lifting restrictions put in place to curb it.
item.title: South Korea worries about a COVID-19 resurgence

item.dc:creator: Jeremy Warner
item.description: Today's lockdowns do seem to mark the transition from one age to another, but not to the imagined bright new dawn.
item.title: Coronavirus is launching us into a new era of poverty, turmoil and conflict

item.dc:creator: Roy Ward
item.description: Storm coach Craig Bellamy hopes AFL diehards will follow his side for a couple of weeks, and believes the "six again" rule could prove a boon for Cameron Smith.
item.title: 'Six again' rule could help Smith, Storm: Bellamy

item.description: The book will reflect on the broadcaster's career, exploring and documenting the natural world, and the decline of the planet's environment and biodiversity he has observed.
item.title: Attenborough to set out vision for future in new book

item.dc:creator: Georgina Mitchell
item.description: The woman acted with "cruelty" after perceived misbehaviour by the child, a judge said.
item.title: Woman jailed for five years after making child drink Dettol

item.description: Researchers believe the societal conditions produced by the coronavirus lockdown provide an opportunity to break the chain of sexually transmitted infections.
item.title: Down to just one COVID-19 case, NZ is moving to stamp out STIs

item.dc:creator: Sally Rawsthorne
item.description: The man who killed Thomas Kelly in 2013 attacked the president of the Rebels Penrith chapter inside Silverwater Prison in 2018.
item.title: One-punch killer Loveridge sentenced to an extra month for prison fight

item.description: Wearing only undies and ECG dots, Benedict Kearney carjacked a woman, sped down the wrong side of a road and then bit a policeman who tried to arrest him.
item.title: Alien fear led undie-clad man to carjack woman, bite cop, court told

item.description: The indictment, unsealed on Thursday in Washington's federal court, is believed to be the largest criminal enforcement action ever brought against North Korea.
item.title: North Koreans charged in wide-ranging $3.7B sanctions-busting scheme

item.dc:creator: Richard Baker
item.description: Former sex discrimination commissioner Elizabeth Broderick has found a deeply troubling workplace culture at Airservices Australia, the federal agency responsible for safe skies.
item.title: 'Boys' club': Inquiry finds unacceptable sexual harassment, bullying at Airservices

item.dc:creator: Jon Pierik
item.description: Collingwood supporters have until midnight on Sunday to bid for their cardboard cut-out to be used in round two while the AFL boss has backed broadcasters to use canned noise.
item.title: Clock ticks for board Magpies fans as AFL backs canned noise

item.description: Philippe Sands encounters the sons of two high-up Nazis and discovers one still sees his murdering father as a good man.
item.title: Unravelling a troubling Nazi legacy

item.dc:creator: Simon Johanson
item.description: As the industry toasts the lifting of lockdown laws next week, publicans say bouncing back from the brink is not as simple as pouring a pint.
item.title: Australian pubs face a long road back after lockdown

item.dc:creator: Nick Bonyhady
item.description: The Australian Manufacturing Workers Union has called for increased government support for the sector within weeks as forward order volumes plummet and factories close.
item.title: 'When manufacturing goes, it goes': Union warns sector under pressure

item.dc:creator: Michael Fowler
item.description: While ski workers are unperturbed by socially-distant village life, one Falls Creek business says the stress of preparing is 'like peeling an onion'.
item.title: 'Super stoked': Seasonal snow fiends hyped for season like no other

item.dc:creator: Matthew Knott
item.description: The social media executive order Trump signed today is not a mortal blow to freedom of speech - but the threat of action might make Twitter back off.
item.title: Trump doesn't care if he wins his fight with Twitter, he just wants the battle

item.dc:creator: Erin Pearson
item.description: No charges will be laid against man who shot stepfather in head after coroner revealed older man was doomsday prepper who planned to 'go out in a blaze of glory'.
item.title: Stepson killed 'doomsday prepper' in self defence, coroner told

item.dc:creator: Katrina Strickland
item.description: Hear Konrad Marshall's cover story about the challenges of long-distance love, followed by a discussion with Good Weekend editor Katrina Strickland.
item.title: Home is where is the heart is: long-distance love affairs
